answers.answer: it's not unusual to have issues with vaginal yeast actually.have you met with your gyn to discuss how to get on top of this for once and for all?  sometimes you need long term oral diflucan to get the yeast gone for good. Also probiotics like fem dophilus by jarrow can also help to keep the "good" bacteria in the genital tract for you ( google it for info ).  birth control pills can also cause yeast to be a chronic issue too. plenty of informative websites out there with suggestions on how reduce your risk of chronic yeast by watching what underwear you wear, what hygiene products you use etc.this is not a std related issue so any future posts should be on the women's health type forums here - thanks!grace

question: hi am 23 i have been having reap ted yeast infection for the last two and half years i even tested for HIV many times and i tested negative i took many over the counter medicines but its no use i know that i don't have diabetes am confused what seams the causeThis discussion is related to/posts/show/247222.
title: reasons for repated yeast infection
